verbs.description: Kom Jong Un [V: has] provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . Just because he made his assurances to Trump does not mean we should believe him .
[ARG0: Kom Jong Un] has [V: provided] [ARG1: vague promises to work on denuclearization] . [ARGM-CAU: Just because he made his assurances to Trump does not mean we should believe him] .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to [V: work] [ARG1: on denuclearization] . Just because he made his assurances to Trump does not mean we should believe him .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . Just because [ARG0: he] [V: made] [ARG1: his assurances to Trump] does not mean we should believe him .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . Just because he made his assurances to Trump [V: does] not mean we should believe him .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . [ARG0: Just because he made his assurances to Trump] does [ARGM-NEG: not] [V: mean] [ARG1: we should believe him] .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . Just because he made his assurances to Trump does not mean we [V: should] believe him .
Kom Jong Un has provided vague promises to work on denuclearization . Just because he made his assurances to Trump does not mean [ARG0: we] [ARGM-MOD: should] [V: believe] [ARG1: him] .
